result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A. Johannes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars except in furtherance of his employment at Johann's Bar & Grill, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program, in the event an invitation is extended to join the program.  

Defendant must complete the ID process with the Sheriff's Department by no later than October 15, 2015.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered amount paid in this matter to be applied to 15CM5

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas A. Johannes
Current: N1257 Cty Rd B, Coloma, WI 54930 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: W11254 Cumberland Rd, Coloma, WI 54930

15CM-5 and 15CM-378 - Both Cases Called @ 2:12 PM: Defendant Nicholas A. Johannes in court with attorney Sarvan Singh.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has been made aware that a resolution has been reached.  ADA - recites resolution.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Court explains in detail plea agreement reached today - Def will plea to 3 different offenses today.  Conviction will be entered solely to 15CM-378 with probationary sentence being imposed.  Proceedings will be suspended pending performance on probation as to 15CM-5 with entry of plea only.  All terms and conditions of bond will continue - any violations that might occur may result in agreement today being set aside.  If probation is successfully completed, State will move the Court for vacature of the 2 convictions entered today with request for dismissal of both convictions.  At the time of sentencing as to 15CM-5 - record of performance on supervision will be part of penalty argument.  Def advised of min/maximum penalty as to OWI 3 offense.  Off Record Discussion.  Back of Record at 2:25 PM:  Intention of parties is to return for sentencing on 15CM-5 in late Dec of 2016.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant - Def understands Plea QN - meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained as to 3 charges.  Agrees with 2 prior convictions as recited by Court.  Ellements of offense explained.  Counsel agree there is a factual basis for the charges as to 15CM-378.  15CM-378 - Complaint Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CM-5 Ct 1 AC Plea:  NC.  15CM-378 Ct 1 (DC):  NC  Ct 2 (Neg Op of MV):  NC  Court accepts knowing and voluntary pleas and enters JOC 15CM-378 only.    15CM-5:  Court withholds entry of JOC as to Ct 1 and suspends proceedings.  Bond to continue in its present format.  Ct 3 dismissed w/o prejudice.  Ct 2 dismissed outright.  15CM-5 placed in suspended status.   Court affirms findings after discussions and confirmation of Plea QN.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  Statement by Atty Singh as to bond conditions - travel out of state would not be a violation of bond.  Court does not believe that there are any problems as to bond ordered with firearms possession and/or the bar prohibition as to employment.  The Court:  15CM-378 - both counts -  S/W - 15 mos probation.  Conditions:  Complete AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars unless in furtherance of his employment at his parents' bar (Johannes), and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Complete WC TAD Program as a condition of probation in the event an invitation is extended to join the program, it is believed that Def will be offered the program by the panel - Def is ordered to apply and complete the program if accepted - performance on program will have a significant impact on sentencing as to 15CM-5; Costs to include DNA surcharge - 60 DTP or PP - no DNA sample ordered.   Upon successful completion State will file MOD to vacate conviction and dismiss charges.  Def reminded that bond will be continuing.  Appeal Rights Given  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 27, 2016 at 11:30 am.
